'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-06-06 19:26:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (3 inline comments)

I'm having an argument with myself over whether a patch like this makes sense.  It adds a lot of complication to the whole quota infrastructure for resources which are generally only counted per project rather than per user; and yet, I can see the argument for allowing a tenant to give each of its users specific limits.  However, at present, that would take intervention by the nova admin, since only nova admins can access the quota setting methods‚Ä¶"}, {'account_id': 3191, 'date': '2012-06-07 10:00:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Hi Kevin, thanks for your interest & review!

As far as we know about current version of Openstack, a user can easily start instances with resources more than his real need. For instance, a 'bad' user could use up the quota of a project, leaving no resource left for other users. So we started to think that the user's behavior is somehow needed to be controlled. That is the motivation of per-user quotas. 

Yet we are quite new to Openstack, we proposed it now to the community for discussion.

It is true that adding a feature like this requires changes to the original quota infrastructure, but is not so much from the point of our view. You can see that we did not intend to change the infrastructure, but to add it more like refinement. A quota definition without per-user quota is not different from the original mechanism. 

Also we think it's a good way to give user quota by tenant itself, without the intervention by the nova admin, but a
 'projectadmin' role is needed to implement this.

Finally, it's very glad to get your advice on our code‚Ä¶"}, {'account_id': 3191, 'date': '2012-06-11 01:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-11 01:42:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Doesn't seem to work

Hi Kevin, thanks for your interest & review! 
As far as we know about current version of Openstack, a user can easily 
start instances with resources more than his real need. For instance, 
a 'bad' user could use up the quota of a project, leaving no resource left 
for other users. So we started to think that the user's behavior is somehow 
needed to be controlled. 
That is the motivation of per-user quotas.

Yet we are quite new to Openstack, we proposed it now to the community for discussion.

It is true that adding a feature like this requires changes to the original quota 
infrastructure, but is not so much from the point of our view. 
You can see that we did not intend to change the infrastructure, 
but to add it more like refinement. A quota definition without per-user quota 
is not different from the original mechanism.

Also we think it's a good way to give user quota by tenant itself, without the 
intervention by the nova admin, but a 'projectadmin' role is needed to implement this.
Finally, it's very glad to get your advice ‚Ä¶"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-06-11 13:38:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Some minor nits, but I think there is a larger question here along the lines of what Kevin mentioned.

Should we have per-user quotas or per-role? From a administrative/scaling perspective going down the road of per-user settings is bad. Per-role at least is easier to manage. Per-project is even better."}, {'account_id': 3191, 'date': '2012-06-12 08:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-12 08:51:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Adds per-user-quotas support.

Implements blueprint per-user-quotas.

It implemented based on the origin quota structure.

NOTE:
quota_instances, quota_cores, quota_ram, quota_volumes,
quota_gigabytes and quota_security_groups are supported
for per user.

Change-Id: I2753416e64c14ac31dc1e2bf34f9706fc944b21f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-08 00:13:16.000000000', 'message': 'Make object server's caching more configurable.

The object server had a constant KEEP_CACHE_SIZE = 5*1024*1024;
unauthenticated GET requests for files smaller than KEEP_CACHE_SIZE
would not evict the file from the kernel's buffer cache after it was
read from disk.

Now that hardcoded constant is a configuration parameter
("keep_cache_size"), and now there is also another parameter called
"keep_cache_private". If set, then both authenticated and
unauthenticated GET requests for small files will not evict the data
from the buffer cache. The default values are 5 MiB and False,
respectively, so the default behavior is the same.

Bonus: the "mb_per_sync" parameter is now documented in the deployment
guide.

Change-Id: I9a11dbe861f4c23535c6aa82a9111a6fe2db2a59
'}]
commit_message:
Make object server's caching more configurable.

The object server had a constant KEEP_CACHE_SIZE = 5*1024*1024;
unauthenticated GET requests for files smaller than KEEP_CACHE_SIZE
would not evict the file from the kernel's buffer cache after it was
read from disk.

Now that hardcoded constant is a configuration parameter
("keep_cache_size"), and now there is also another parameter called
"keep_cache_private". If set, then both authenticated and
unauthenticated GET requests for small files will not evict the data
from the buffer cache. The default values are 5 MiB and False,
respectively, so the default behavior is the same.

Bonus: the "mb_per_sync" parameter is now documented in the deployment
guide.

Change-Id: I9a11dbe861f4c23535c6aa82a9111a6fe2db2a59

subject: Add i18n context module to redefine function _()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2649, 'name': 'Zhang Hua', 'email': 'zhuadl@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'zhang-hare'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-04-24 18:08:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Please keep your reviews specific to a single bug or blueprint. Additionally, the second bug referenced in your commit message has already been fixed."}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-04-26 09:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-07 20:49:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(6 inline comments)

See in-line comments‚Ä¶"}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-05-09 09:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-09 15:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Inline is a question‚Ä¶'}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-05-10 04:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-10 14:26:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Same question as before: Why do we need to exclude i18ncontext.py from the PEP8/hacking check?  I'm sure you have a good reason for it, but I need to know what it is."}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-05-11 10:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-05-14 02:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Kevin: 
The reason is  i18ncontext module defined function _(message)  which will fail PEP8/hacking check:  "N701 rule: Empty localization string". It seems that the Hacking module defined i18n related compliance rule and test with prefix of N7xx.  All function call of _() in module will be checked if it is using i18n message string.  however,  i18ncontext module is redefinition of the old _() function, not function call,  which will make it look like an empty string. I found 3 methods to resolve this problem:
1. Excluded i18ncontext to avoid failing the test. 
2. Modify the hacking module to skip this kind of _() function definition
3. Rename the fucntion _(message) in i18ncontext to dgettext(message)
I prefer to use option 3 and abort the change to exclude PEP8/Hacking check.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-14 18:25:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

One HACKING problem; see in-line.

I think you're going to have difficulty getting anyone else to review this patch.  It may only be ~300 lines, but you touch virtually every .py file in the tree, which means the patch looks intimidatingly large.  What I would suggest is submitting one patch with just the i18ncontext.py file, then several patches with, say, around 10-20 files per patch, all dependent on the patch with i18ncontext.py.  That will result in less intimidating patches and make it easier to handle conflicts until you get everything merged."}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-05-15 02:23:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-05-15 02:32:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Kevin, It really get me into a lot trouble to amend this patch since it touch lots of modules which needs i18n and the community evolve so quickly. I made too much efforts to rebase, merge and testing to make this forward and completely fix this bug. Your suggestion is good for me. But it doesn't make sense to fix the bug. Part of the commit will make it incomplete and hard to explain and submit the remaining part of patch."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-15 16:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

*shrug*'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-05-21 10:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I have looked at all of the files and they are all consistent.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-23 13:18:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not sure I buy this approach. This might sound silly, but it's asking a lot to add two lines to every file for i18n. Is there absolutely no way to modify nova/__init__.py to correctly set up gettext?"}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-05-24 05:55:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Same idea as I tried to solve this issue. 
According to my research on gettext, it is using binary tree to store and search the i18n string within a domain. So each domain is represented by a tree. There're two approach to use gettext: 
1) Install the domain once and use it as default domain afterwards, which is dynamic and implicit.
2) Bind multiple domains and use it with domain specified, which is static and explicit.

For approach 1,  you must keep the context correct in each module initilization and make sure no context switch. If you install another domain elsewhere in the same process, the previous domain won't be available any more which means the context is lost. Currently openstack is using this approach but has i18n issue as reported in bug 974810. it can be fixed by defining only ONE domain accross all components. This requires to put all strings together in one place. Or we can decouple client code from server code. This might be able to avoid switching i18n context since client code might not need globalization. but who knows!

For approach 2, it requires each module to declare which i18n context to be used. This is why you can see many files were added two lines of code."}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-05-24 06:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I take back what about the binary tree. It is not accurate. The file format can support binary search for origin strings.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-01 06:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-01 06:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

If the API calls want to get a localized message from server, how to deal with this case?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-06-01 16:44:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

When we use the client code we are catching specific exceptions, so we can provide localized messages in nova for those exceptions if needed.'}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2012-06-05 04:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Since we have addressed two options to resolve this problem discussed a lot in the mail list. One is to re-architecture the current design to decouple client and server code which has become true now. The other one is this patch set without re-architecturing which seems more feasible at the time of first submission. it might be valuable for the previous ESSEX release if someone still want to resolve this problem without re-architecturing, I think. :-)'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-12 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Add i18n context module to redefine function _()

Fix Bug 974810.

Add new i18n context modules to redefine the default i18n function _(message)
with correct boundled text domain for each component(nova, glance etc). This
will avoid overriding the old domain when installing new domain by calling
gettext.install().

Change-Id: I7e4899726df9e7e24b9b8154881972c3de6c2665

A lot of great work here. 

Some suggestions + questions inline.  We should also sync up on what remains to be done, as hopefully we can farm it out to other people.  I'll start working on some of the changes around the plugin api + db layer."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-06-12 03:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-06-12 03:58:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: (2 inline comments)

I think we're getting to the point where we can consider pushing this branch.  

This branch still has a few gaps, but the again, Rome was not built in a day.  I think we can get this merged in, then work on follow-up patches to finalize the implementation.  Particularly as Jason will not be as available in the next week or so.  

I for one am already working on improving API input validation, as well as adding some more unit tests.  I'll then move on to finalizing the plugin API and fixing various issues around the db-plugin-base implementation.  

Does anyone have concerns with this approach?"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-06-12 03:58:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Unfortunately, I was doing a bit  more testing and this branch needs a few tweaks to prevent breaking existing plugins when the v1.x apis are in use.  

Several plugins import BASE from quantum.db.models, but that variable has moved to quantum.db.base_model.  

You can run the quantum unit tests with the OVS plugin using: 

PLUGIN_DIR=quantum/plugins/cisco ./run_tests.sh -N

They pass with that change.  Ryu plugin unit tests also fail for the same reason.  Grep suggests that the cisco plugin also requires changes, though its unit tests don't seem to report an error.  

If we can get this fixed up, I think we can get this merged early monday, as gary + yong will be core devs by then and I haven't heard any objects on our plan to merge this in."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-06-12 03:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

one other comment: 

this highlight the fact that any plugin-specific unit tests that can run with just the dependencies of quantum iteself should be in the main plugins dir, so they are run automatically by tox.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-06-12 03:58:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, this is a big leap forward, so let's get this merged.  This will let more people work on different aspects that still need to be tweaked."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-06-12 03:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Add API v2 support

* Implements BP v2-api-melange-integration
* Adds v2 Plugin specification
* Refactors SQLAlchemy usage for multiple BASE's

Change-Id: I45f008f181c18269afdfe4a9b589a7c5ae56d225

Fixing bk file for install deploy guide.

This fix corrects the PDF file name referred to in the link at the top page of the webhelp output.

Change-Id: I6906a1cf4b106d2bd9a1da174bec1043d3503476

(1 inline comment)

Inline nit.  More importantly you shouldn't be messing with FLAGS directly in tests. There is a helper in the testing class to change them that automatically resets them when the test is over.

self.flags(flag_to_set=new_value)

Please replace things like:
FLAGS.compute_driver = 'fake'

commit_message:
add unit tests for new virt driver loader

Continues work on bp:virt-driver-cleanup

Add unit tests to test the loading of the new and old style loaders

Fix libvirt driver to make read_only optional on the constructor

Fix fake driver to correctly have the kwarg be read_only

Add VirtDriverNotFound exception to make get_connection failures more
explicit

Factor out fake backend replacement (currently just libvirt) to a
seperate super class

Remove touching FLAGS and use self.flags instead

Change-Id: I089d0dd9c97f87478b922f4c3e26c45891eaf6cc

commit_message:
Some sqlite tables have indexes that are missing in mysql.

I don't love the exception handling for if the instance
already exists, but I don't have a better plan. Is it ok
to tweak an existing schema version like this?

Change-Id: I8dde2c654302e2abf0f956071091d6d6aa06f2e8

commit_message:
UUID Cleanup.

This cleans up and humanizes a lot of
the places UUIDs are used throughout the
UI. Especially between volumes and
instances.

commit_message:
Only invoke .lower() on non-None protocols

When using source group based security group rules (rather than CIDR
based ones), it's permissible to not set a protocol and port. However,
Nova would always try to convert the protocol to lower case, which would
fail if the protocol wasn't set.

Fixes bug 1010514

Change-Id: I9b1519a52ececd16a497acebfe022508cbe96126

commit_message:
Dependency Reconcilliation

Fresh installs seem to have dependency
issues, this fixes Horizon to explicitly
state which parser to use, as django-
compress incorrectly tries to use a
compressor that is not installed on some
fresh installs.

Fixes bug #1010968

Change-Id: I62ac5fd43b846cf967077e0a3d1e16db5861223c

commit_message:
Consistency for volume attachment display.

Use instance names, not UUIDs, and make sure names are always
linked and got to appropriate places.

Change-Id: I954b9fc88cd3f38d4bcc761668370c1a89cc14c8

commit_message:
Flush tenant membership deletion before user

Ensure user tenant membership is *actually* removed before deleting
user.

Applied to 'stable/essex', originally committed to trunk via
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7353/

Fixes bug 998137.

Change-Id: Ib52970d68f288b8742c3e060c7040838a1c738c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-11 13:16:08.000000000', 'message': "Only invoke .lower() on non-None protocols

When using source group based security group rules (rather than CIDR
based ones), it's permissible to not set a protocol and port. However,
Nova would always try to convert the protocol to lower case, which would
fail if the protocol wasn't set.

Fixes bug 1010514

Change-Id: I9b1519a52ececd16a497acebfe022508cbe96126
"}]
commit_message:
Only invoke .lower() on non-None protocols

When using source group based security group rules (rather than CIDR
based ones), it's permissible to not set a protocol and port. However,
Nova would always try to convert the protocol to lower case, which would
fail if the protocol wasn't set.

Fixes bug 1010514

Change-Id: I9b1519a52ececd16a497acebfe022508cbe96126

commit_message:
Remove the conf passing PasteDeploy factories

Implements blueprint cfg-global-object

In glance.common.wsgi we have a paste_deploy_app() API which allows
a ConfigOpts instance to be passed the the applications and filters
constructed by PasteDeploy.

Now that we're using a global object, we don't need this anymore

Change-Id: I222d3c58308bc2f504cd802c0c8405d3baa2e49a

commit_message:
Add BeautifulSoup dependency for Horizon

This is a workaround for an undocumented dependency on the Python
BeautifulSoup package.  It fixes both Ubuntu and Fedora builds.

Fixes bug 1010968

Change-Id: If7f5d55c38d3b9ab677378c57839bc8f03898e2f

commit_message:
Fix test env for the stable branch

Need both changes in one commit to pass the gate!

* Nail pep8 dependencies to 1.0.1.

Nails the pep8 deps for tox and test-requires to 1.0.1.
Fixes an issues causing pep8 failures due to a new pep8 release.

(cherry picked from Nova stable)

* Switch to 1000 rounds during unit tests

Fixes bug 992918

passlib 1.6 introduced a minimum number of rounds for sha512_crypt. As
a result, increase the rounds used during testing to the minimum

Change-Id: Ic0c635e92b4f13180a047904a6efa490ab599012

Later versions, such as 1.1 which is currently on pypi raises

tools/test-requires already pins to 0.6.1, but the CI infra now

commit_message:
Added pinning for dep pep8==0.6.1 in tox.ini.

Later versions, such as 1.1 which is currently on pypi raises
issues that the Essex code base doesn't comply with.

tools/test-requires already pins to 0.6.1, but the CI infra now
uses tox, which had no declaration.

This will ensure that the CI testing uses the version of pep8
that was previously in use, and Essex was developed against.

In addition, added myself to AUTHORS

Change-Id: I42195c8a5473b65e0aef8b398ecbf641bbb9fbc4

commit_message:
Align tox.ini and fix coverage jobs in jenkins.

The jenkins coverage jobs expect there to be a .coverage file, so deleting
it is a bad idea. Also, coverage erase will do that for us.
While we're in there, update tox.ini and setup.cfg to the latest.

Change-Id: Icd0a8fc66a5146e0d94f62a9f65a4536981d2916

commit_message:
Make CLI exit nonzero on error.

This makes it much easier to detect failure in scripts.

Fixes bug 973557.

Change-Id: Ie9ae8e18094f9bbf12fd56dcfc17fce2cedcd5fd

commit_message:
Switch to 1000 rounds during unit tests

Fixes bug 992918

passlib 1.6 introduced a minimum number of rounds for sha512_crypt. As
a result, increase the rounds used during testing to the minimum

Applied to stable/essex, originally merged into master via
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/6997/

Change-Id: If615b78000684ec8bb850d543bdb53eb2904e613

'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-06-08 10:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Is this something everyone really wants?'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-06-08 12:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

This change is not so much for swift itself, but for those who are wanting to use swift. All of the openstack projects are moving to a "main" and "client" repo model. Initially, this change will most help other openstack projects like glance.

The first idea of simply letting packaging handle it won't work since those using pip (ie the openstack-ci people) don't use packages and pip doesn't support multiple deliverables in one repo.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-06-08 22:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Mostly looks good. My one concern is the pip requirement of python-swiftclient from git master. With that, a change to python-swiftclient could break the Jenkins tests for swift.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-06-11 06:16:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

well the binding should always be backward compatible and tested with swift to make sure we don't broken anything. I believe the CI team is in process to added the swift functional tests. FWIW this is the way the other projects and client binding works. Monty can you confirm?"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-06-11 15:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

A few notes about the concern of client changes breaking server testing:

- REAL SOON NOW we should be properly and regularly relasing python-swiftclient to pypi, so we should be able to replace that line with a regular "python-swiftclient=2.0.1" type line
- Until then, if needed, tags or specific sha1s can be added to the requires line to tie to specific version'}, {'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2012-06-11 16:54:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-06-11 17:26:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

As long as there's a plan to lock it down once we can, I'm happy with this change."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-11 17:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/281/ : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/164/ : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-11 17:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Remove swift.common.client from here.

- It has been to its own gerrit project.
- direct_client should follow next.
- Implements blueprint clientbindings.

Change-Id: I3bb50c95eba81302bfec71cb7ce5288b85a41dc0

commit_message:
Flush tenant membership deletion before user

Ensure user tenant membership is *actually* removed before deleting
user.

Fixes bug 998137.  This should be proposed to stable/essex as well.

Change-Id: I47ed55502e9dd636d93ec4eb4e365cef4178eaf2

Remove unused imports

Fixes bug #1010276

commit_message:
instance_destroy now only takes a uuid.

As requested in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8218/. You'll get an
exception if you pass a non-uuid in.

Change-Id: I0e54eeba7ea65fa8f6640b47c47abf8c7b4f6b79

subject: Make jsonutils.dumps more general
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 159, 'name': 'Eric Windisch', 'email': 'ewindisch@docker.com', 'username': 'ewindisch'}, {'_account_id': 385, 'name': 'Jason K√∂lker', 'email': 'jason@koelker.net', 'username': 'jason-koelker'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 1994, 'name': 'Zhongyue Luo', 'email': 'zhongyue.luo@gmail.com', 'username': 'zyluo'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

keystone/common/wsgi.py and glance/common/wsgi.py'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

No, so if I call this as:

    dumps('beavis', default=hozer)

It will then call into json.dumps as:

    json.dumps('beavis', default=to_primitive, default=hozer)

What you want is this:

    def dumps(value, **kwargs):
        if 'default' not in kwargs:
            kwargs['default'] = to_primitive
        return json.dumps(value, **kwargs)

Or some variation on that."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Teach me not to read comments ;) Or like Doug said and do the  dumps as:

    def dumps(value, default=to_primitive, **kwargs):
        return json.dumps(value, default=default, **kwargs)'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

But wouldn't the default value passed in kwargs override to_primitive?"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

FYI - if this gets updated, also add Fixes https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-common/+bug/1010859'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Fixes my problem: http://paste.openstack.org/show/18411/'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This version will prevent someone from overriding default (they will get an error when the kwargs are passed to the underlying function because default is included explicitly). Maybe that's what we want, or maybe default should be spelled out as an argument to the wrapper, too?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/90/ : SUCCESS'}]

commit_message:
Do not attempt to kill already-dead dnsmasq

Check that the dnsmasq process is running (and actually looks like a
dnsmasq process) before attempting to kill it. Fixes bug 1010275.

Change-Id: Ib49209e1624dfb30470adbe13d7fc045ec1fdf83

subject: Create a utf8 version of the dns_domains table.
messages:
[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:09:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The way this works is users will need to update their Nova packages and then run 'nova-manage db sync' to apply the update/fix.

Subsequent runs of 'nova-manage db sync' will check the format of the dns_domains table and skip the update.

Works for me... but someone else should double check too."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

How do this affect from stable/essex to folsom?'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-09 19:50:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Chuck,

Upgrade from Essex to Folsom will still work fine.

The migration in Folsom will simply re-create the DNS domains table again. This won't cause any issues and is perfectly safe. We could make the Folsom migration a bit more clever and skip the migration if it has already be applied... as things stand now the upgrade should work fine."}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-06-10 01:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Nice work Dan, looks good

Since unpatched api/network services will continue to work with the new DB schema and patched api/network services work with the old DB schema, I think this works well as a fix for essex.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-11 13:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-08 21:07:39.000000000', 'message': "Create a utf8 version of the dns_domains table.

The old dns_domains table was encoded in the 'latin1'
charset and has its primary key length set to 512.
This is too long to be a valid pkey in a proper 'utf8' encoded
table and seems to cause a slew of errors like:

1) Dumping a database with mysqldump and trying to import it fails
because this table is latin1 but fkeys to utf8 tables (projects).

2) Trying to alter the old dns_domains table fails with errors
like:
mysql> ALTER TABLE dns_domains DROP PRIMARY KEY;
ERROR 1025 (HY000): Error on rename of './nova/#sql-6cf_855'....

This patch creates an Essex fix that re-creates the dns_domains
table with a shorter 'domain' column which works with the utf8
charset. This database upgrade will run on MySQL databases only
which have a dns_domains table with a domain column length of
VARCHAR(512).

Fixes LP Bug #993663 on Essex.

Change-Id: I97888fbc18ebfc0e25c9ba31160588c9cdf5c448
"}]
commit_message:
Create a utf8 version of the dns_domains table.

The old dns_domains table was encoded in the 'latin1'
charset and has its primary key length set to 512.
This is too long to be a valid pkey in a proper 'utf8' encoded
table and seems to cause a slew of errors like:

1) Dumping a database with mysqldump and trying to import it fails
because this table is latin1 but fkeys to utf8 tables (projects).

2) Trying to alter the old dns_domains table fails with errors
like:
mysql> ALTER TABLE dns_domains DROP PRIMARY KEY;
ERROR 1025 (HY000): Error on rename of './nova/#sql-6cf_855'....

This patch creates an Essex fix that re-creates the dns_domains
table with a shorter 'domain' column which works with the utf8
charset. This database upgrade will run on MySQL databases only
which have a dns_domains table with a domain column length of
VARCHAR(512).

Fixes LP Bug #993663 on Essex.

Change-Id: I97888fbc18ebfc0e25c9ba31160588c9cdf5c448

commit_message:
Bug #1007153

XS should not have the centos repo enabled by quantum this can break the system, also is possible to get the sqlalchemy from epel and avoid unneeded packages on the system.

Using epel rpm and leave it disabled after use

Change-Id: I6f1a049126055d0b04a4fd5800a0257977449486

  ImportError: No module named common'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-11 04:55:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, I think the issue here is that stable/essex Quantum is designed to work with python-quantumclient-2012.1

We need to figure out some way to have the stable/essex unit tests uses that version of quantumclient - perhaps it should be released to pypi and we can just add

  quantumclient=2012.1

to tools/pip-requires

commit_message:
Base patches to ensure that the essex stable version passes unit tests

The task only makes the minimum necessary changes to ensure that the
essex version is ready for ready cherry picking of fixed bugs in Folsom

Change-Id: Ie7d6bb7df3ca2a8fed57a3de3f82733581e1677b

commit_message:
Do not always query deleted instance_types.

When converting from flavorid to instance_type_id in the OSAPI,
it isn't always desired to return deleted instance_types. In the case
of OSAPI create(), we explicitly do not want to query deleted flavors.

Fixes bug 1010638

Change-Id: I9c26c7130f8c3d6680143e36b4aaa1f662c682a7

commit_message:
Fixes bug lp:999928

    The CIDR affinity filter currently matches the scheduler's IP address against
     the network specified by the 'build_near_host_ip' and 'cidr' scheduler hints.
     It should be matching each compute host's IP address against the network
     in the scheduler hints.
     Ensure that the compute host's IP address is reported as part of host_state
     and use this value in the filter.
     this issue has been talked at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7470/

Change-Id: I14eac8797dfe8aaf870bb31ef7bf87edcf691f93

commit_message:
Avoid partially finished cache files.

`VDI.copy` stores half-completed files directly in the SR where we may
inadvertenly make use of them. To avoid these 'half-baked' records, we
compare its current size to its expected size.

Fixes bug 1009750

Change-Id: I0f279ce69bfa0842a6bc74f19fd61462c6013b28

commit_message:
Rename image to image_id.

The variable name `image` was a bit misleading since we're dealing with
an ID and not an Image object. This renames the variables to clarify
that fact.

Includes some other small cleanups like using new-style classes and replacing
`if X is True` with `if X`.

Change-Id: Ic1378da203cfb3e199b9d2f1a14911bc7e24a1f5

Add user_name project_name and color option to log

 * adds project_name and user_name to context for logging
 * adds color argument to logging which allows for colored
   log output based on the log level

subject: Wait for resource deletion after 202 response. Fixes bug 1007447.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-05 23:53:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Some nits to address inline, but overall, lgtm."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-06 02:01:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Grr. I use Eclipse/pydev which doesn't seem to show this kind of whitespace. Is there some command line thing that will show it?"}, {'account_id': 4120, 'date': '2012-06-06 02:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

on linux/vim you can try :set list to show such hidden whitespaces/tabs'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-06 11:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

David, sure, you can use:

 pep8 --repeat tempest'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-06 12:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-06 17:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-06-07 06:23:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(2 inline comments)

Couple of minor concerns, but I'd like to see what others think"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-07 12:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

With regard to forcing an override, if I were using Java I would have made this method abstract. I know there is a way to do this in Python using abc. The original stress test submission used this but Jay suggested we wanted to avoid that in Tempest. 

With regard to RestClient, I think the issue is similar to the issue we were discussing about the right place for resource tracking. On the one hand, it would be nice to say that RestClient is stateless and just does http serialize/deserialize. On the other hand, each client returns values and codes that only it knows how to further interpret because of individual API differences. The two cases (so far):

1. How to know when a 202 operation really finishes.
2. How to delete a resource.

What if we just made a ResourceTracker class and had the various subclasses of RestClient also inherit from that? Then move the disputed state and methods to that class.
Of course we all would then have to understand how multiple inheritance in Python really works, which is still a little mysterious to me :).'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-07 15:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I would like to push this in now because it does fix a test failure. For some presumably timing-related reason the failure does not occur in a devstack/tempset all-in-one scenario assuming that is what the jenkins job is doing.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-09 18:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

code lgtm. I will clean up some of the abstract base class stuff in a serparate patch...'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-09 18:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-gate-merge/92/ : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-pep8/178/ : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-09 18:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-05 18:10:56.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for resource deletion after 202 response. Fixes bug 1007447.

Added RestClient.wait_for_resource_deletion that waits for a subclass-specific condition.
Added RestClient.is_resource_deleted that implements a subclass-specific deletion predicate.
Removed redundant test by combining floating_ip associate/dissacociate into a single test.

Change-Id: Iac043b12e8d5a5e88786e3b573280bfbc3f6a8d6
'}, {'created': '2012-06-06 12:44:49.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for resource deletion after 202 response. Fixes bug 1007447.

Added RestClient.wait_for_resource_deletion that waits for a subclass-specific condition.
Added RestClient.is_resource_deleted that implements a subclass-specific deletion predicate.
Removed redundant test by combining floating_ip associate/dissacociate into a single test.

Change-Id: Iac043b12e8d5a5e88786e3b573280bfbc3f6a8d6
'}, {'created': '2012-06-06 17:48:09.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for resource deletion after 202 response. Fixes bug 1007447.

Added RestClient.wait_for_resource_deletion that waits for a subclass-specific condition.
Added RestClient.is_resource_deleted that implements a subclass-specific deletion predicate.

commit_message:
Wait for resource deletion after 202 response. Fixes bug 1007447.

Added RestClient.wait_for_resource_deletion that waits for a subclass-specific condition.
Added RestClient.is_resource_deleted that implements a subclass-specific deletion predicate.
Removed redundant test by combining floating_ip associate/dissacociate into a single test.

Change-Id: Iac043b12e8d5a5e88786e3b573280bfbc3f6a8d6

commit_message:
Update default values for known_stores config.

Updates the default value for the 'known_stores' config
variable to include the full list of storage classes
supported in Glance.

Also, removes the known_stores config section from the
example config file since it is arguably an advanced config
that won't get used by most users. Removing this config avoids
the overhead of maintaining internal class names in config files.

Fixes LP Bug #1008698.

Change-Id: I0117376aa4de3103410ecb1a36df6998fcd0d5b5

commit_message:
Add 'explain' command to v2 that describes schemas

At its core, this is adding the ability to finx a schema through
published links and convert it to a usable object.

Related to bp glance-client-v2

Change-Id: I7b38ad091c6b0ad80197eb789503cf73989893e5

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/89/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll go ahead and patach and push through the fix."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Not missing anything. They fail for me too ;(. I need to get with monty to gate us on tests now that we are up and running.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ah, yes, I bet so.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ticket for the CI team to give the assist! https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ci/+bug/1010610'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This patch broke a test for me.  We really need to start gating on unit tests.


======================================================================
FAIL: test_utcnow_ts (tests.unit.test_timeutils.TimeUtilsTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/rbryant/src/openstack/openstack-common/tests/unit/test_timeutils.py", line 77, in test_utcnow_ts
    self.assertEqual(ts, skynet_self_aware_timestamp)
AssertionError: 872853240.0 != 872806440.0
    '872853240.0 != 872806440.0' = '%s != %s' % (safe_repr(872853240.0), safe_repr(872806440.0))
    '872853240.0 != 872806440.0' = self._formatMessage('872853240.0 != 872806440.0', '872853240.0 != 872806440.0')
>>  raise self.failureException('872853240.0 != 872806440.0')'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oops. I mean it passes only for the people in China.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

utcnow_ts is only used in nova/common/memorycache.py

using timeutils.strtime I think we can change utcnow_ts something like this.

 def utcnow_ts():
     """Timestamp version of our utcnow function."""
-    return time.mktime(utcnow().timetuple())
+    return strtime(fmt="%s")

Although this version returns a int rather than a float, I don't think it changes the logic in memorycache.py'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I just found out that mktime returns localtime reading the document. Could that be why it is passing for me and not for people in China?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A patch like this should work.

 def utcnow_ts():
     """Timestamp version of our utcnow function."""
-    return time.mktime(utcnow().timetuple())
+    return float(strtime(fmt="%s"))'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-08 21:17:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add nova time util functions to timeutils

Fixes bug #1009410

1. Add the following functions from nova/utils.py
- strtime
- parse_strtime
- is_older_than
- utcnow_ts
- advance_time_delta
- advance_time_seconds

2. Write unittests in tests/unit/test_timeutils.py

Change-Id: Ie0bba90833e2ed31bb5ab867a7c1a76a9901cacb
'}]
commit_message:
Add nova time util functions to timeutils

Fixes bug #1009410

1. Add the following functions from nova/utils.py
- strtime
- parse_strtime
- is_older_than
- utcnow_ts
- advance_time_delta
- advance_time_seconds

2. Write unittests in tests/unit/test_timeutils.py

Change-Id: Ie0bba90833e2ed31bb5ab867a7c1a76a9901cacb

This patch updates the ZeroMQ test module to use OSError in one place
instead of ProcessExecutionError from nova.exception.  In a previous rev
of this code, it was using nova.utils.execute(), but no longer does.

Change-Id: I3dac2981b5c1a7cd5fc0e4e8dbf0a2d378a1d136
'}]
commit_message:
Use OSError instead of ProcessExecutionError.

This patch updates the ZeroMQ test module to use OSError in one place
instead of ProcessExecutionError from nova.exception.  In a previous rev
of this code, it was using nova.utils.execute(), but no longer does.

Change-Id: I3dac2981b5c1a7cd5fc0e4e8dbf0a2d378a1d136

commit_message:
Make eventlet backdoor play nicer with gettext

Fixes bug 1010236

Implement a new sys.displayhook that doesn't overwrite __builtin__._
that was set by gettext

Change-Id: Id3c0a331eb6f98240fe1e4d0b083c72e28f99c53

commit_message:
Cleanup and refactoring of identity docs.  Bug #972370

Update Patch:
* Reverted Change-Id: I48fa41fa45943f2848483c1c9f56402f49cf00af (You should be able to associate a token with 0 or more tenants.)
* Removed extra white spaces.
* Fixed samples with OS-KSEC2-s3Credentials -> OS-KSEC2:s3Credentials
* Removed stale / commented code snippets.
* Clarified optional encryption in OS-KSVALIDATE
* Fixed copyright note in OS-KSVALIDATE

Change highlights
- Placed all extensions in an individual folder within: openstack-identity-api/src/docbkx/extensions/
- Each extension has its own folder which contains its doc devguide, WADL and sub-folders with samples and xsd
- WebHelp and PDF generated for all extensions
- Removed unused files
- All extensions are documented

Extensions:
* HP-IDM
* OS-KSADM
* OS-KSCATALOG
* OS-KSEC2
* OS-KSS3
* OS-KSVALIDATE
* RAX-GRPADM
* RAX-KSGRP
* RAX-KSKEY
* RAX-KSQA

Updated used version of doctools to 1.3.0

Change-Id: I9b16ee44252481680cce90eb044d081a65eaf336

subject: Add support to include config aliases
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Joe - thanks much for this, and sorry I took so long to review

I've a few issues:

1) The naming of the option doesn't really clarify how this should be used - would deprecated_name be better?

2) We really need to support aliases for CLI options too in order to include this

3) The semantics where there are multiple config files and a mixture of new/old opt names is wrong - e.g. if you have two config files, the new option used in the first and the old option used in the second, then the value in the first file will win

I think what you want here is:

  class MultiConfigParser(object):

      def __init__(self):
          self.parsed = []

      def read(self, config_files):
          ...
          for filename in config_files:
              sections = {}

              parser = ConfigParser(filename, self.sections)
              ...
              self.parsed.insert(0, sections)
          ...

      def get(self, section, names):
          for sections in self.parsed:
              if section not in sections:
                  continue
              for name in names:
                  if name in sections[section]:
                      return sections[section][name]

4) The aliased_used logging is useful. However, it puts some parsing state into the Opt class which I'd like to avoid. Opt should not be modified during parsing.

What you need is for _get_from_config_parser() to return alias_used and to include alias_used in the cache for querying by log_opt_values()

It's probably best to just leave the logging out of the first cut of the patch and address it in a subsequent patch

5) It might be nice to support multiple aliases, rather than just one

6) One thing I can see is wanting to do is introduce groups where there wasn't groups before, so you'd want e.g.

  o = StrOpt('foo', deprecated_name='DEFAULT.bar')
  conf.register_opt(o, group='blaa')

That's a bit ick, though. Opt knows nothing about groups currently and I'd like to keep it that way. Would this work?

  o = StrOpt('foo', deprecated_name='bar')
  conf.register_opt(o, group='blaa', deprecated_group='DEFAULT')




Sorry for the long review - I think 1, 2 and 3 need to be address. The other ones can be follow-on additions"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Mark,

Thank you for the feedback I am working on addressing your points.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Nice work Joe, but see my comment inline about (3)

I think you'll need to address it the way I outlined - it can't be a case of "look through all the config files for the new name, then look through all the config files for the old name"'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Mark, 

1,2,3 are fixed.  If I understand 3 correctly, it already worked -- see added unit test (test_multi_conf_file_str_value_use_deprecated).'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(4 inline comments)

Really excellent work Joe, thanks for your patience'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/88/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-08 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Add support to include config aliases

Implements blueprint config-aliases

* Supports loading deprecated aliased options from a config file
* Supports using deprecated aliased CLI options
* For MultiStrOpt Can use mix of name and alias

Change-Id: I04678880bc8ee1f85335f5656367bd1437245c6e

fixed.

subject: Create 'simple' db driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-31 22:55:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build Failed 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-glance-pep8/48/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-glance-merge/48/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-glance-python26/48/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-glance-python27/48/ : FAILURE"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-31 22:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-31 23:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-glance-pep8/50/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-glance-merge/50/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-glance-python26/50/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-glance-python27/50/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-04 16:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

The paradigm in use in Nova and other places is to have the database driver be selectable via a flag/config option. I think we should stick to that paradigm here for consistency. That way, we can simply have unit tests' base test case class set CONF(db_driver='glance.db.fake.Driver').

Also, I think it's better to change "simple" to either "fake" or "memory" to make it clear it is not for production use.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-04 16:27:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

We're definitely on the same page with respect to the import approach. Check out my dependent patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8049/. It's a ways down the stack of patches since I had to do QUITE a bit to make it work somewhat reasonably.

As for the name...I don't want to imply that it shouldn't be used, as it could be useful for ephemeral setups like devstack (that's why I didn't call it 'fake'). It came down to either 'simple' or 'memory', and I wanted to stay away from 'memory' as to not encroach on a possible 'memcache' driver. So I was left with 'simple'. Do you agree with my thought process?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-04 16:57:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Yep, I totally understand, now that I've had a chance to look at some of the dependent branches...

Sticking with simple would be fine, yep, though I'd prefer memory myself. I don't think it would be confused with memcache, since it's clear from the flag value it is the db driver (glance.db.memory.Driver...)

Either way, it's a nit. Change if you feel like it, otherwise, I won't complain :)"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-04 17:04:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think I'd prefer to leave it as 'simple' for now. I'm just leaving the door open for a possible 'memcache' db driver...

I'll rebase this guy once I get another +2"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-04 19:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-04 19:57:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Went ahead and rebased'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-04 20:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm. thx Brian.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-04 20:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build Successful

commit_message:
Create 'simple' db driver

Move the core of glance.tests.unit.utils:FakeDB to glance.db.simple.
This 'simple' driver is an alternative to the traditional sqlalchemy
driver. Additionally, the sqlalchemy driver has been moved from
glance.db to glance.db.sqlalchemy. The simple db driver is only
available to be used by tests for now.

Related to bp refactor-db-layer

Change-Id: I9d33a433c0c03e53fb5a3491076086427ae694b3

[{'account_id': 357, 'date': '2012-05-13 21:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-05-15 09:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As I see the compressor uses node-less(lessc) to compress files. I've got this error:

/bin/sh: 1: lessc: not found

I'm not quite sure if it needs to be added in the requirements, or is will be added along with another library. I'm a bit confused with the package requirements and building."}, {'account_id': 2458, 'date': '2012-05-15 09:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Did you follow the instructions in the README? Either of the install examples I put in there SHOULD have added it in that location. 

If not, can you tell me what the output of "which lessc" is?'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-05-15 09:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ups, sorry, my bad. I've looked for node-less in the requirements file, not in the README. Everything is OK - "apt-get install node-less" works fine. I was just wondering if this should be added in the pip-requires as well... My question here is more on how the package requirements are handled.'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-05-15 17:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

How does this affect users with custom css?'}, {'account_id': 2458, 'date': '2012-05-15 19:01:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Tihomir:

Unfortunately, PIP cannot handle external application requirements (such as installing Node.js, and LESS.) As such, this has to remain a requirement that is just handled by the person installing Horizon that is covered by the documentation.

Chuck:

Really, it shouldn't... 

If one wants to they can still include/use .css files in their dashboards, and the horizon.less file is exactly the same as the previous horizon.css file, so any overwrites/etc should still work just fine."}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-05-16 11:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-05-17 19:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-merge/559/ : SUCCESS"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-24 23:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

node is a big dependency just for lesscss.

I wonder could this feature be tweaked to
give a configuration option to run lesscss on the client?

That might be desired to reduce load on the server,
or to ease the installation burden due to node
not being easily available for all platforms at present.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-25 07:55:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

For reference: there's a thread on the mailing list related to the addition of Node.js as a dependency:

https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg12244.html"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-05-25 08:58:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Bundling code that we don't maintain (the less binary) is really a bad idea: results in code duplication which causes security vulnerability management issues... We've been there before with ajaxterm, and we don't really want to go back there... Is that really the only solution ?"}, {'account_id': 2458, 'date': '2012-05-25 16:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

This is really no different than packaging jQuery with our code (which we do.) Everyone seems to think the lessc executable is a binary: it is not, it is just a JS file. See here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7367/4/bin/less/lessc

This is going to be no more difficult to maintain than jQuery and Bootstrap currently are...'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-05-28 14:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

I guess "the less executable" would have been a slightly more accurate description :)

If it is obvious to all that the LESS code will only be duplicated *until* there is proper support in distros for it (and is not there to stay forever), then I'm happy to reverse to +0. I'd still prefer if we could cover the needed features using Python code, but i suppose you did your research and couldn't find any.'}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2012-05-30 21:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Thierry: The real long term solution is to make it purely a packaging issue for distros and have less/node.js only installed in order to "build" the compressed css/etc. So I can get behind your assertion.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-05-31 21:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-05-31 21:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I have updated the patchset to include thorough documentation on the node.js dependency and how to work around it in deployment scenarios where node.js is not an option (see docs/topics/deployment).

As such, I believe it meets all the requirements stated by the discussion thread on the mailing list, it passes the unit tests, works correctly in-browser, and generally looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-31 21:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Updating Horizon to use LESS.

This changes all of the Bootstrap CSS and Horizon
CSS to use LESS. Horizon's specific CSS will be
organized into separate files in another commit,
as it is outside the scope of this BP.

We are also now packing LESS 1.3.0 directly within
Horizon.

Implementation of Blueprint transition-to-lesscss

Change-Id: Ie4be8b28ab3ce04ea21d7d5cd49c2ccb66bd8ade

[{'created': '2012-06-07 01:01:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove pips.

All of the requirements should now be specified in the pip-requires
of individual projects, which will be installed via setup.py install.

Therefore, remove the few remaining pip dependencies from devstack.

Distutils has a problem installing django 1.4 when django 1.3 is
already installed via debian packages.  Therefore, remove the
dependency on the django debian package (which installs 1.3
and is obsolete anyway).

Change-Id: Ia4dc1f4c94c7f5c0811bafcf41dadc5d629a516d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pips.

All of the requirements should now be specified in the pip-requires
of individual projects, which will be installed via setup.py install.

Therefore, remove the few remaining pip dependencies from devstack.

Distutils has a problem installing django 1.4 when django 1.3 is
already installed via debian packages.  Therefore, remove the
dependency on the django debian package (which installs 1.3
and is obsolete anyway).

Change-Id: Ia4dc1f4c94c7f5c0811bafcf41dadc5d629a516d

commit_message:
Use pip to install python depends.

When we use python setup.py develop, if there is a packages not installed
already, it means distutils/easy_install installs it. Unfortunately, those
are both way more stupid than pip. Instead, get pip to install missing
depends, then run the setup.py develop so that distutils doesn't need to
install things.

Change-Id: Ifad3bbc8e9eac0b14dc5bb40175cf2bd45b64b00

commit_message:
Replace standard json module with openstack.common.jsonutils

Implements blueprint use-common-jsonutils

1. Edit openstack-common.conf and import nova/openstack/common/jsonutils.py
2. Remove json package imports and replace with jsonutils

Places where using json.load hasn't changed.

Change-Id: Ie6feab605fb0474fd505c56ef57b7a9ecfa5269d

This section of code is a huge problem when you have 500 compute hosts and you restart computes all at once. :)  nova-network just gets slammed like crazy.  It's also possible that one is using the NoOp firewall driver... which makes these queries completely unnecessary.

In any case.. I think a better fix to this problem is to not query network at all.  There should be a copy of the network data in the instance_info_caches table.  I think we should just change this to use instance['info_cache'] (iirc, that's how it's joined).

It'd also be nice if somehow we could tell if it's even necessary to do this loop at all...  but I think that's a separate issue from this bug."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-31 14:07:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Thanks for the feedback, Chris!  I'll take a look at reworking this."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-05-31 20:21:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No prob.  There's a slight concern that the copy of network info in the Nova DB is out of sync... but a better solution would be try to sync it up periodically, I think, instead of hitting nova-network pretty hard any time nova-compute starts up.  There's already a periodic task for periodically grabbing the network information and updating the cache..  that might be a good spot to see if anything changed and update the fw rules if so.  But, again, that portion probably is a separate patch."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-06-01 15:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-06-01 16:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Don't query nova-network on startup.

Fix bug 999698.

nova-compute requested network info for each instance on startup via rpc.
If all services get (re)started at the same time, nova-network may not
be available to take this request, resulting in a lost request.  To
combat this issue, get the network info from the cache in the database
on startup.  If by some chance this information is not correct, it will
get fixed up by a periodic task.

Change-Id: I0bbd475e078ac2a67c99c2be4711e86d617c609a

commit_message:
Finalize tox config.

Shrink tox.ini to the new short version.
Fix the test cases to be able to be run in nosetets plus the
openstack.nose_plugin, which finally removes the need for
nova/testing/runner.py
Also, now we'll just output directly to stdout, which will
make nose collect the trace logging directly and either output
it at the end of the run, or inject it into the xunit output
appropriately.

Change-Id: I1456e18a11a840145492038108bdfe812c8230d1

commit_message:
Updated Sphinx documentation

- Added examples using the API
- Added API reference pages
- Added docstrings to classes so they would be picked up by sphinx
- Removed warning about CLI coming soon

Change-Id: I6e187efe508c5ae310ec97efe4650495f958306d

commit_message:
fix importing of optional modules in auth_token

* keystone/middleware/auth_token.py: Catch the
correct exception so that the memcache and iso8601
modules can be optional as intended.
* tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py: Test
the ImportError path
* keystone/test.py: Add a new mixin class to
support disabling importing of a module.

Bug: 1003715
Change-Id: I87cc2f3bc79b17a52ea672bac7e0ebcf9e1fce57

commit_message:
Bug #1002605

update webob to be version 1.2 or above

It's running without any issue with 1.2, the exception problem was caused
by WebTest. We should use at least version 1.3.3 (supplied by Ubuntu 12.04 and Debian Wheezy)

Version to WebTest==1.3.3

Change-Id: Ia8ef543e32ae46f503dd52e93bed4290d077c286

commit_message:
Quantum should use openstack.common.jsonutils

Implements blueprint use-common-jsonutils

1. Edit openstack-common.conf and import quantum/openstack/common/jsonutils.py
2. Remove json package imports and replace with jsonutils
3. Remove json related functions in common/utils.py

Change-Id: Id5abc49175899fa4d83e613f852aaaac539ecfcb

commit_message:
Clean up a few ugly bits from the testing patch.

The pep8 runner in run_tests.sh was still referencing run_tests.py
which no longer exists. Replaced that section with one that runs
pep8 the same way as tox.

Additionally, the first attempt at getting the test runner to do the
same thing with debug logging as run_tests.sh was doing became a bit
spammy. For now, actually have logging write out the log file in the
first place. Eventually, it would be nice to get this to properly
get spit out in such a way that nosetests would grab it and include
it in the failed test case output.

Change-Id: Ib5222a0c3507d5d7ede4d303c98323a622705301

commit_message:
Glance should use openstack.common.timeutils

Implements blueprint use-common-timeutils

1. Edit openstack-common.conf and import glance/openstack/common/timeutils.py
2. Replace datetime.utcnow with timeutils.utcnow
3. Replace utils.isotime with timeutils.isotime
4. Replace utils.parse_isotime with timeutils.parse_isotime
5. Replace utils.normalize_time with timeutils.normalize_time
6. Remove datetime related functions and datetime related unittests

Change-Id: I014548848f738b00c670be3d372b16f47f6dee96

commit_message:
Quantum should use openstack.common.jsonutils

Implements blueprint use-common-jsonutils

1. Edit openstack-common.conf and import quantum/openstack/common/jsonutils.py
2. Remove json package imports and replace with jsonutils
3. Remove json related functions in common/utils.py

(cherry picked from commit dedefaeea3d9547e58af8f263327b8bfd28296f1)

Change-Id: I542cea5865fcfd653dde50c4e29156074c00ee90

commit_message:
Cleans up power_off and power_on semantics

compute.api changes:
  * improves state handling for delete/restrore
  * removes hack to deal with SHUTOFF on start
  * fixes api tests (volume shouldn't detach on stop)

compute.manager changes:
  * uses power_off/power_on for stop/start

virt.libvirt changes:
  * implements power_off/power_on for libvirt
  * synchronizes usage of domain.create()
  * cleans up usage of instance.name
  * added tests for power_on and power_off
  * fixes bug 1006950

Change-Id: I91845a643e3f97955e7c81ca57c6ee5aa0a3d295

commit_message:
fix side effects from seekability test on input file

Fixes Bug #1007093

Mixing use of os.lseek(fileno, 0, os.SEEK_SET) with
file.seek seems to cause problems when reading data
with file.read

Change-Id: Ia96ce9bbdc93a1a8c6169d85b99187f8cd7b2fdc

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4211, 'name': 'Patrick Mezard', 'email': 'patrick@mezard.eu', 'username': 'pmezard'}]

[{'account_id': 4211, 'date': '2012-05-06 18:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-07 15:47:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-08 00:17:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So I wasn't seeing failures running test_multiprocessing on OS X and still don't with this patch. I was seeing the tests hang when using Monty's branch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7007/), and now instead of hanging with his code, the tests just fail. That is an improvement, but not quite the final solution. Can you check out his code on top of yours and see what you get?"}, {'account_id': 4211, 'date': '2012-05-08 10:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I should not have said "Fix Bug 994609" in the changelog. As Brian noticed, this patch only makes the test suite terminate instead of hanging.

The real issue is the use of "poll" API which Kevin questioned in the inline diff. I intended to look into that in a second patchset, when trying to fix the failure itself. My reasons to split the fix in two parts are:
- This is my first contribution to openstack and I wanted to keep things simple until I know more about the whole process.
- There are many ways to deal with the "poll" issue (autodetect, make it configurable, etc.), and I expect the next patchset to require more design and polish, while the current one seemed straightforward (coding conventions nonwithstanding).

I skimmed Monty patchset but could not see anything related to test_multiprocessing/wsgi/eventlet so I do not think it address the same problem. I consistently reproduced the issue on glance master.

Would this patch be acceptable if:
- The "Fix Bug 994609" mention is dropped from the changelog
- UnrecoverableWorkerError exception class is moved into the correct file and inherit glance base exception
?

Otherwise I would stop this approach and focus on the eventlet bug itself.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-08 16:17:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So I confirmed that this stops the test from hanging on a machine that acts similarly to yours. This is ok to land once Kevin's fixes are implemented with the understanding that you'll try to fix the root cause. If this were causing the tests to fail on the Jenkins boxes, we couldn't merge it, but if it's not causing any regressions there AND it's helping those with the problem get around it then I think this is ok."}, {'account_id': 4211, 'date': '2012-05-09 10:00:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-09 14:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-05-09 19:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Simple enough'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-09 19:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

commit_message:
wsgi: do not respawn on missing eventlet hub

Eventlet 'poll' hub is not available on OSX, wsgi.Server workers have no
chance to start but the error was not caught and they were respawned
endlessly. This patch makes these workers not to be respawned.

This has the nice side-effect of avoiding the test suite to get stuck in
test_multiprocessing on OSX, filling syslog.

Change-Id: I565d21f5c6861102e96d6953ace29cde57e8ec38

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/84/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Looks good to me, my only comment would be if we can figure out a way to make RpcFakeTestCase.test_call_timeout not take 2 seconds ;) possibly faking out the socket connect or whatever so that it raises immediately. But not a blocker.

Let me know when you think this is gtg and I'll +2 it."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If you're good with this, I think it's safe to approve at this point.

One thing I'm not a big fan of is how I stuck eventlet.monkey_patch() in the unit tests.  I'm open to suggestions for a better way of handling it.  It just assumes whatever uses the code has already done the necessary monkey patching.  In nova, it's done in bin/nova-*."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Regarding the dependencies, it's mainly so it gets installed in an environment for running unit tests.  Qpid isn't listed because it's not in Pypi.  :-(  The Qpid unit tests don't run in Jenkins for nova, either.

I'm trying to get someone to add it to Pypi.  When that happens, we can add Qpid to pip-requires."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Great work! Thanks'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I see a dependency for kombu, but not qpid. Should it be added to pip-requires? It isn't clear that either should really be a "dependency" since a given installation will only use one or the other.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Expecting the caller to set up eventlet seems OK. The app has to know to do that anyway, because it has to happen very early, right?

It's too bad about qpid and PyPI, but we'll get by until they post a package.

Let 'er rip!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-07 14:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Add rpc to openstack-common.

Implements blueprint common-rpc.

This patch imports nova.rpc to openstack-common.  All of the necessary
changes to the core code to make it compatible with openstack-common
have been done in nova, so the only changes made here are to imports.

There are more changes made to the tests, but nothing that changes the
core functionality of the tests.

Change-Id: I17330aa4adfd0f22c449a2376833c7fe9dfd0cf1

commit_message:
Raise ClientException for invalid auth version.

  error.

Dean, while I really don't care all that much.  What we currently have as far as an outline is an older replication of the README.rst along with a toc entry and an index entry.  I kept the toc entry and removed the index because it was largely broken.

I'm willing to say heck we'll deal with it when we deal with it, but until then ( probably not until this thing nears completion ) the docs will be largely broken and old. In email discussions we decided that the master branch should always
pull in the lastest version of the pep8 tool, which keeps us closest
to the real pep-8 document.  Therefore, I'm removing the hardcoded
version here to match the lack of a pep8 version in tox.ini (which is
what the CI infrastructure uses when running the gating pep8 checks).

Change-Id: I242cb042cff5f5969aa50d40312f87979191c7b7

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded version for pep8 from tools/test-requires

In email discussions we decided that the master branch should always
pull in the lastest version of the pep8 tool, which keeps us closest
to the real pep-8 document.  Therefore, I'm removing the hardcoded
version here to match the lack of a pep8 version in tox.ini (which is
what the CI infrastructure uses when running the gating pep8 checks).

Note that your pep8 version will only update when you re-run
pip install --upgrade -r tools/test-requires .

Change-Id: I242cb042cff5f5969aa50d40312f87979191c7b7

Actually, Jay, my bad. It wasn't a bug in the original code.  Originally we called undefine before waiting, so we were waiting for the instance to disappear completely (not found). Now we are just waiting for the destroy to complete (goes to shutoff). The undefine now happens in the cleanup. We don't need to wait for the cleanup/undefine step to complete before continuing, as it is just libvirt removing the xml for the instance from its db."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-04 19:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Refactor libvirt create calls

 * minimizes duplicated code for create
 * makes wait_for_destroy happen on shutdown instead of undefine
 * allows for destruction of an instance while leaving the domain
 * uses reset for hard reboot instead of create/destroy
 * makes resume_host_state use new methods instead of hard_reboot
 * makes rescue/unrescue not use hard reboot to recreate domain

Change-Id: I2072f93ad6c889d534b04009671147af653048e7
